ags:resource.dc:title: Primeros resultados de la caracterización del contenido estomacal de juveniles 0+ de atún rojo Thunnus thynnus
ags:resource.dc:subject: Thunnus thynnus
atún rojo
juvenil
alimentacion
contenido estomacal
ags:resource.dc:description: Stomach contents from 19 dead young bluefin tuna were analyzed in the framework of the SELFDOTT project (From capture based to SELF-sustained aquaculture and Domestication Of bluefin tuna, Thunnus thynnus). The fish were captured close to Cartagena (Murcia- Spain) between the 3rd and the 16th of October 2008, using the «curricán» method (a Spanish term meaning to fish by trailing a baited line along behind a boat). The first stomach analyses show that cephalopods are the main prey (53% in weight 49% in number), followed by fishes (28%, 24%) and crustaceans (2%, 27%). The main prey species is the squid Illex coindetti.
ags:resource.dc:identifier: De la Gándara, F., A. Ortega, A. Belmonte, J.L. Varela, A. Medina, F. Esteban, M. Pérez y N. Morató 2009. Primeros resultados de la caracterización del contenido estomacal de juveniles 0+ de atún rojo Thunnus thynnus. Libro de resúmenes del XII Congreso Nacional de Acuicultura.Madrid Noviembre de 2009: 94-95
